intro: Mentha, commonly known as mint, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Lamiaceae. It consists of approximately 15–25 species, most of which are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their aromatic, often strongly scented leaves and square stems. Mint species are perennial herbs that typically grow in moist, shaded environments. They are widely cultivated for their culinary, medicinal, and aromatic properties.
